episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and fascinating facts, including the lingering effects of the Iron Curtain on Czech deer, the overcrowded roads of Monaco, the long-burning underground fire in Centralia, Pennsylvania, and the first recorded traffic casualty involving a Roman pig.

facts.fact: Czech deer still avoid crossing the Iron Curtain between Germany and the Czech Republic.
If every car in Monaco decided to go for a drive at the same time, they wouldn't fit on the roads.
The town of Centralia in Pennsylvania has been on fire since 1962.
The first recorded traffic casualty was a Roman pig who was run over by a chariot carrying an ornamental phallus.
